qas.question: Hydropower is produced in how many countries?
Which country is the largest hydroelectricity producer?
How many hydroelectricity plants are larger than 10 GW?
What is the average cost of electricity from a hydro plant larger than 10 megawatts?
Hydropower is not produced in how many countries?
Which country is the smallest hydroelectricity producer?
How many hydroelectricity plants are larger than 20 GW?
What is the average cost of electricity from a hydro plant smaller than 10 megawatts?

context: Hydropower is produced in <a0_0><b4_0>150<b4_0/><a0_0/> countries, with the Asia-Pacific region generating 32 percent of global hydropower in 2010. <a1_0><b5_0>China<b5_0/><a1_0/> is the largest hydroelectricity producer, with 721 terawatt-hours of production in 2010, representing around 17 percent of domestic electricity use. There are now <a2_0><b6_0>three<b6_0/><a2_0/> hydroelectricity plants larger than 10 GW: the Three Gorges Dam in China, Itaipu Dam across the Brazil/Paraguay border, and Guri Dam in Venezuela. The cost of hydroelectricity is low, making it a competitive source of renewable electricity. The average cost of electricity from a hydro plant larger than 10 megawatts is <a3_0><b7_0>3 to 5 U.S. cents per kilowatt-hour<b7_0/><a3_0/>.
